pullRequest.title: Adding new query features
pullRequest.bodyText:
-This PR adds support for the following query types

GroupBy
NonValueAggregates
MultipleAggregates

-Some fixes for distinct query

commit.message: Adding support for Nonvalue and Multiple Aggregates.

Fixing aggregates an groupby
Adding tests for non value and multi aggregates and group by.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into groupby-query-feature-support

# Conflicts:
#	sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos/src/main/java/com/azure/cosmos/models/ModelBridgeInternal.java

nodes.bodyText: POJO end user type is not expected to extend JsonSerializable. Why are we extending the POJO test classes from POJOSerializable?
please move the test POJO types to standalone files outside of TestSuiteBase. Same as Pet class, etc.
I think as per central SDK guideline we should avoid protected access modifier. @kushagraThapar please comment if protected is fine here.
license file header here and in other new files.

nodes.bodyText: if this is fatal, wrap in approprate RuntimeException and rethrow.

commit.message:

nodes.bodyText: Error check  if value is not map ?
Should we close the stream  ?
nit: formatting , aligning all parameters
nit: space after if
nit: return can be removed , implicit lambda
"payload" spread across few files , can we centralize it with constant ?
nit: space after else
nit: empty line after if
do we need else, wouldn't it by default null ?
final string can be avoided
nit: extra line after if
can keys be null ?
these two if can be merged
What is the use of map here ?
why is this needed?
why continuation token is null here?
we should make these constants. here and elsewhere
we should make this constants, ditto. here and elsewhere
can any of the public APIs of GroupingTable be invoked on different email threads. if so you will have race condition on updating these internal states.

Constant names should be all upper case with underscores.
ARRAY_HASH_SEED

There is no API in FeedResponse#responseContinuation
Did you mean getContinuationToken() ?
Please follow java naming conventions here.
Here as well - naming.
Since there is no ordering in the keySet() API - are we just limiting with maxItemCount randomly on the keys in this.table map ?

Please use this constructor instead of concatenation of error :
public IllegalStateException(String message, Throwable cause)
Nit : Extra comma at the end.

     OffsetAndLimit,
     OrderBy,
-    Top
+    Top,

nodes.bodyText: Don't return in an if else. Predeclare the variablee and return at the end.
returning null is a soft contract. Is there a TryGet equivalent in Java?
if "payload" does not exist, then this should throw an exception.
sealed (which I think is final in Java).
This class is missing a lot of the hash seeds.
This isn't going to work, since 1.0 and 1.00 need to hash to the same value. Also strings and their different escaped variants.
sealed.
null check the other argumetns.
readonly list
null checks.
there is a typo here.
final
avoid the cast multiple times
Add tests for 1 vs 1.0 and escaped string
There are a lot of other cases that need to be covered.
We need to add tests for this if you are going to turn the flag on.
